SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

de.systemagmbh.common.util
Class CSysExtendableArray

java.lang.Object
  de.systemagmbh.common.util.CSysExtendableArray
Deprecated. As of release 2.5, deprecated without substitution

public class CSysExtendableArray
extends Object

This class stores elements of exact one type of class. The elements will be unique in this array. No instance of a class can be added two times to this storage class. The contents of this storage class can be delivered as Array of the specified type. 


     public static void main (String arg[])
     {
           ExtendableArray eaTest = new ExtendableArray (Integer.class, false, false);
           Integer int1 = new Integer(1);
           Integer int2 = new Integer(2);
           Integer int3 = new Integer(3);
           eaTest.addElement (int1);
           eaTest.addElement (int2);
           eaTest.addElement (int3);
           eaTest.addElement (int1); // Nothing will happen
           eaTest.addElement (new String()); // Nothing will happen
           Integer[] intArray = (Integer[]) eaTest.toArray();
     }

Author:
Anton Scheungrab

Method Detail

storableObject

public boolean storableObject(Object obj)
                       throws IllegalArgumentException
Deprecated. 
Returns information if the given object can be stored in this class. This function would even result in a RuntimeException if a wrong type of class is given here (not the one stored in classType or one of its decendants)

Parameters:
obj - The object which should be stored
Returns:
True, if this class can be stored, false otherwise
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - is thrown, when a wrong type of class is given to this function

toArray

public Object[] toArray()
Deprecated. 
Copies the contents of this ExtendableArray in a Java-Array. This array is return anonymous (as array of objects) so it must be typecasted by the calling function.
